data.title: Planet Earth II (2016)
data.summary: David Attenborough returns in this breathtaking documentary showcasing life on Planet Earth.

data.title: Planet Earth (2006)
data.summary: Emmy Award-winning, 11 episodes, five years in the making, the most expensive nature documentary series ever commissioned by the BBC, and the first to be filmed in high definition.

data.title: The Joy of Painting (1983–1994)
data.summary: In this half-hour program, artist Bob Ross paints on canvas a beautiful oil painting.

data.title: Cosmos: A Spacetime Odyssey (2014– )
data.summary: An exploration of our discovery of the laws of nature and coordinates in space and time.

data.title: Blue Planet II (2017–2018)
data.summary: David Attenborough returns to the world's oceans in this sequel to the acclaimed documentary filming rare and unusual creatures of the deep, as well as documenting the problems our oceans face.

data.title: Cosmos (1980)
data.summary: Astronomer Carl Sagan leads us on an engaging guided tour of the various elements and cosmological theories of the universe.

data.title: The Vietnam War (2017)
data.summary: A comprehensive history of the United States' involvement in the bitterly divisive armed conflict in Southeast Asia.

data.title: The World at War (1973–1976)
data.summary: A groundbreaking 26-part documentary series narrated by the actor Laurence Olivier about the deadliest conflict in history, World War II.

data.title: Leah Remini: Scientology and the Aftermath (2016– )
data.summary: A series featuring stories from former members of the Church of Scientology whose lives have been affected by the Church's harmful practices.

data.title: The Civil War (1990)
data.summary: A comprehensive survey of the American Civil War.

data.title: Human Planet (2011)

data.title: The War (2007)
data.summary: A seven-part series focusing on the many ways in which the Second World War impacted the lives of American families.

data.title: Homicide Hunter: Lt. Joe Kenda (2011– )
data.summary: Lt. Joe Kenda solves cases.

data.title: Mayday (2003– )
data.summary: Dramatized reconstruction of real-life air disasters, along with interviews with aviation experts and eyewitnesses.

data.title: The Blue Planet (2001)
data.summary: Mammoth series, five years in the making, taking a look at the rich tapestry of life in the world's oceans.

data.title: Vice (2013– )
data.summary: Documentary series featuring startling, groundbreaking stories from around the world.

data.title: Nathan for You (2013– )
data.summary: Nathan Fielder uses his business degree and life experiences to help real small businesses turn a profit. But because of his unorthodox approach, Nathan's genuine efforts to do good often draw real people into an experience far beyond what they signed up for.

data.title: Forensic Files (1996– )
data.summary: A series featuring detailed accounts on how notable crimes and diseases were solved through forensic science.

data.title: 30 for 30 (2009– )
data.summary: ESPN Films' 30 for 30 is an unprecedented documentary series featuring today's finest storytellers from inside and outside of the sports world. What started as a celebration of ESPN's 30th ...                See full summary »

data.title: One Strange Rock (2018– )
data.summary: The extraordinary story of Earth and why it is special and uniquely brimming with life among a largely unknown but harsh cosmic arena; astronauts tell the story of Earth through unique perspective.

data.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown (2013– )
data.summary: Anthony Bourdain visits countries, delving into their political issues as well as indigenous food and culture.

data.title: Making a Murderer (2015– )
data.summary: Filmed over a 10-year period, Steven Avery, a DNA exoneree who, while in the midst of exposing corruption in local law enforcement, finds himself the prime suspect in a grisly new crime.

data.title: The Defiant Ones (2017)
data.summary: "The Defiant Ones" examines the partnership between Jimmy Iovine and Dr. Dre - one the son of a Brooklyn longshoreman, the other straight out of Compton - and their leading roles in a chain of transformative events in contemporary culture.

data.title: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst (2015)
data.summary: Filmmaker Andrew Jarecki examines the complicated life of reclusive real estate icon Robert Durst, the key suspect in a series of unsolved crimes.

data.title: World War II in Colour (2009– )
data.summary: Recounts the events of world War II in color.

data.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol (2011– )
data.summary: With more than 20,000 patients, Dr. Pol has seen it all. Specializing in large farm animals, this senior is anything but retiring as he takes an old school, no-nonsense approach to veterinary medicine.

data.title: Long Way Round (2004– )
data.summary: This documentary series follows actors Ewan McGregor and Charley Boorman on a motorcycle trip around the world. The two friends will travel through such places as Siberia, Kazakhstan, ...                See full summary »

data.title: Hard Knocks (2001– )
data.summary: Hard Knocks is a reality sports documentary produced by the NFL and HBO. Each season the show follows an NFL team during training camp in preparation for the upcoming season.

data.title: Chef's Table (2015– )
data.summary: Chef's Table goes inside the lives and kitchens of six of the world's most renowned international chefs. Each episode focuses on a single chef and their unique look at their lives, talents and passion from their piece of culinary heaven.

data.title: The 2000s (2018)
data.summary: A TV documentary miniseries chronicling the trends, pop culture, and important events that took place from 2000 to 2009.

data.title: In Search of... (1976–1982)
data.summary: Leonard Nimoy hosts investigations into various mysteries.

data.title: Last Chance U (2016– )
data.summary: Intense look inside the world of junior college football, chronicling the stories of players and coaches in the classroom and on the field.

data.title: Inside Look: The People v. O.J. Simpson, American Crime Story (2016–2017)
data.summary: The story of the 1994-1995 trial of former NFL superstar running back Orenthal James "OJ" Simpson for the murder of his ex-wife, Nicole Brown and her friend, Ronald Lyle Goldman.

data.title: Unsolved Mysteries (1987–2010)
data.summary: Combines dramatic re-enactments, interviews and updates, to tell stories of real mysteries, from human to the supernatural.

data.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations (2005– )
data.summary: Anthony Bourdain, chef, writer, traveler, visits places all around the world sampling various foods.

data.title: The Repair Shop (2017– )
data.summary: Some of Britain's most skilled restoration experts breathe new life into much-cherished family heirlooms that are dropped off by members of the public, who reveal the personal stories behind the items.

data.title: American Experience (1988– )
data.summary: A series showcasing documentaries on American history.

data.title: Alone (2015– )
data.summary: Ten survival "experts" attempt to survive alone. The winner receives $500,000.

data.title: Wild Wild Country (2018– )
data.summary: When the world's most controversial guru builds a utopian city deep in the Oregon desert, conflict with the locals escalates into a national scandal. A true story.

data.title: An Idiot Abroad (2010–2012)
data.summary: Brit Karl Pilkington has led a sheltered life. Not having done any traveling, he enjoys living within the comforts of what he knows, basically that being what is purely British. As such, ...                See full summary »

data.title: MythBusters (2003– )
data.summary: A weekly documentary in which two Hollywood special effects experts attempt to debunk urban legends by directly testing them.

data.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours in... (2015– )
data.summary: Richard Ayoade and a celebrity guest spend 48 hours in a popular city to discover the must see tourist attractions.

data.title: QB1: Beyond the Lights (2017– )
data.summary: Follows three high school quarterbacks from different backgrounds, playing in different environments as they face immense pressure and similar challenges in trying to be successful high school quarterbacks.

data.title: The Keepers (II) (2017)
data.summary: A seven-part docuseries about the unsolved murder of a nun and the horrific secrets and pain that linger nearly five decades after her death.

data.title: Dirty Money (2018– )
data.summary: A Netflix Original Series documenting various stories about exposing the greed, corruption, and crime spreading through the global economy.

data.title: Life Below Zero (2013– )
data.summary: The everyday struggles of living in the secluded state of Alaska where one wrong decision could cost you your life.

data.title: Soupçons (2004– )
data.summary: The high-profile murder trial of American novelist Michael Peterson following the death of his wife in 2001.

data.title: Real Detective (2016– )
data.summary: Each episode is a crime solution reenactment of a real murder. The actual detectives offer commentary throughout the show.

data.title: Somebody Feed Phil (2018– )
data.summary: Phil travels around the world sampling food and tradition with friends and a sense of humor.

data.title: The Toys That Made Us (2017– )
data.summary: The minds behind history's most iconic toy franchises discuss the rise (and sometimes fall) of their billion-dollar creations.

data.title: Deadly Women (2008– )
data.summary: True stories of female killers.

data.title: Deadliest Catch (2005– )
data.summary: A documentary series chronicling the real-life high-sea adventures of the Alaskan crab fishermen. This is the most deadliest profession in the world.

data.title: Hitler's Circle of Evil (2018)
data.summary: This is the story of the rise and fall of the Third Reich told like the drama it really was: through the personal relationships of the movers and shakers of the Nazi Party.

data.title: Flint Town (2018– )
data.summary: Documentary following the police department in Flint, Michigan as they struggle with dwindling resources and crumbling infrastructure in a community crippled by violence and a contaminated water crisis.

data.title: A Haunting (2005–2017)
data.summary: An American paranormal anthology previewing stories told by the victims. Victims tell their terrifing encounters with the paranormal. This show contains narrations, frightening reanactments, & religious content.

data.summary: Add a Plot

data.title: The Disappearance of Crystal Rogers (2018– )
data.summary: Series examining the disappearance of Crystal Rogers from her small Kentucky town and the mysterious death of her father a year later. As investigators look closer, other unsolved cases emerge.

data.title: Barbarians Rising (2016– )
data.summary: Rome. The greatest empire the world has ever known. This docudrama tells the story of Rome through the eyes of the empire's many adversaries who battled to see its destruction.

data.title: Explained (2018– )
data.summary: A documentary series that looks to explore the big questions of today.

data.title: Dark Tourist (2018– )
data.summary: From a nuclear lake to a haunted forest, New Zealand filmmaker and journalist David Farrier ('Tickled') visits unusual -- and often macabre -- tourism spots around the world.

data.title: Ugly Delicious (2018– )
data.summary: Chef David Chang travels around the world tasting food from different cultures.

data.title: I Am a Killer (2018)
data.summary: Follows Death Row inmates, who tell the story of how they ended up there.

data.title: Evil Genius: The True Story of America's Most Diabolical Bank Heist (2018)
data.summary: The extraordinary story of the "pizza bomber heist" and the FBI's investigation into a bizarre collection of suspects.

data.title: The Bible (2013– )
data.summary: A religious historical dramatic miniseries about God's creation and physical landmark events leading up to the Crucifixion and Resurrection of our Savior, Jesus Christ.

data.title: Inside Look: The Assassination of Gianni Versace, American Crime Story (2017– )
data.summary: On the morning of July 15, 1997, fashion designer Gianni Versace is shot and killed outside his Miami Beach mansion by wanted spree killer Andrew Cunanan.

data.title: The Confession Tapes (2017– )
data.summary: A critical look into some true crime cases where American law enforcement made up for lack of actual physical evidence by using devious psychological tactics during interrogation in order to extract confessions from naive suspects.

data.title: Hunting Hitler (2015– )
data.summary: After declassified FBI files about Hitler have been released, a group of specialists work together to try and find the truth of Hitler's supposed death. Did he really die in the bunker?

data.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes (2017–2018)
data.summary: A celebration of extraordinary residential architecture from around the world with insight from an accomplished architect and his painfully screeching co-host.

data.title: Ancient Aliens (2009– )
data.summary: Science and mythology - and how they are the same thing.

data.title: Reported Missing (2017– )
data.summary: British documentary following case of missing person from police footage and interviews. Minute by minute account from the 999 call through to its conclusion.

data.title: American Playboy: The Hugh Hefner Story (2017– )
data.summary: The Amazon Original Series draws from unprecedented access to more than 17,000 hours of footage and over 2,600 scrapbooks from Hefner's personal archives, chronicling the life of an American icon and the history of the brand he created.

data.title: Dark Net (2016– )
data.summary: Explores the furthest reaches of the internet and the people who frequently use it, providing a revealing and cautionary look inside a vast cyber netherworld.

data.title: Casting Calls (2018– )
data.summary: Almost every classic Hollywood role was hotly pursued behind the scenes. This series looks at the most famous roles of all-time and reveals the stories behind how they were cast, which other actors were considered, and how your favorite stars landed the part.

data.title: American Pickers (2010– )
data.summary: Mike and Frank are pickers that travel the country and literally would go anywhere just for the prospects of finding antique gold. With the assistance of Danielle they often find themselves in a comedic pickle.

data.title: Wormwood (2017)
data.summary: In 1953, Army scientist Frank Olson takes a fatal plunge from a hotel window. In 1975, a bombshell report ties his death to a top-secret experiment.

data.title: Rotten (2018)
data.summary: Rotten dives deep into the food production underworld to expose the corruption, waste and real dangers behind your everyday eating habits.

data.title: Trump: An American Dream (2017)
data.summary: British documentary series exploring the extraordinary journey of Donald J. Trump through five decades.

data.title: Lore (2017– )
data.summary: Our collective nightmare mythologies are rooted in real-life horror stories.

data.title: Playboy Cyber Girls (2001– )
data.summary: An exclusive look at the best glamour models from the US and around the world. Discover the most glamorous, beautiful women during their photo-shoot and behind the scenes as they share their passions and desires.

data.title: Roman Empire (2016– )
data.summary: Chronicles the reign of Commodus, the emperor whose rule marked the beginning of Rome's fall.

data.title: Hot Girls Wanted: Turned On (2017– )
data.summary: Porn has gone mainstream; the question is, can we handle it? This exploration of the intersection of sex and technology is told through the stories of the people whose lives are defined by ...                See full summary »

data.title: 72 Dangerous Animals - Asia (2018– )
data.summary: From fangs to claws to venomous stings, they all wield deadly weapons. But which creature will be crowned the fiercest of all?

data.title: Inside the World's Toughest Prisons (2016–2018)
data.summary: Imagine being in jail. Now imagine living in a foreign country. Scary? Paul Connelly takes you inside these jails. He shows what living conditions are for the inmates, as well as the guards. You'll never look at prison the same.

data.title: First and Last (2018– )
data.summary: Cameras enter Georgia's Gwinnett County Jail to document the first days of its newest inmates and the final days of those about to be released.

data.title: Cooper's Treasure (2017– )
data.summary: Treasure hunter Darrell Miklos sets out to find shipwrecks originally located by astronaut Gordon Cooper from space in 1963.

data.title: America to Me (2018– )
data.summary: A look inside one of Chicago's most progressive public schools, located in suburban Oak Park.

data.title: In Search of... (2018– )
data.summary: Documentary series hosted by Zachary Quinto based on the 1970s series that examined unexplained phenomena from all over the world.

data.title: Being Bobby Brown (2005)
data.summary: Filmed over the course of six months (January and June of 2004), this ten-episode reality series takes a peek into the life of Bobby Brown and his marriage to pop superstar Whitney Houston.

data.title: Model Squad (2018– )
data.summary: Docuseries following premiere models as they navigate the highs and lows of the modeling world.

data.title: Shahs of Sunset (2012– )
data.summary: Follows a group of affluent young Persian-American friends who juggle their flamboyant, fast-paced L.A. lifestyles with the demands of their families and traditions.

data.title: Made in Chelsea (2011– )
data.summary: A Reality TV show documenting the antics and heartbreaks of a close knit group of twenty-somethings in London's most exclusive borough, Kensington & Chelsea.

data.title: Afflicted (2018– )
data.summary: Seven people suffering with bizarre chronic illnesses hunt for explanation and cures while simultaneously battling with social skepticism and abandonment.

data.title: Teen Mom 2 (2011– )
data.summary: Follows the cast of the second season of '16 and Pregnant', giving viewers an intimate look at the challenges Chelsea, Leah, Jenelle, and Kailyn face raising a child as a teenager.

data.title: Rest in Power: The Trayvon Martin Story (2018– )
data.summary: An in-depth look at the origin and aftermath of the 2012 shooting of Trayvon Martin and subsequent trial of George Zimmerman, which sparked a national debate on race relations and revealed a deeply fractured and divided country.

data.title: Follow This (2018– )
data.summary: A look inside the busy newsroom at BuzzFeed.
